WRITING.TEXT: Ah thanks. It was a tough piece. I started the background first..Tried to make a city scape. Failed miserably. Painter her over top as a revival to the piece and it came through
Sorry didn't mean it to come off as so dramatic. She was going through a lot of mental health issues at the time and I wanted to portray the internal conflicts.

WRITING.TEXT: It sold over the weekend but I have others that are available in a similar style. http://www.artoframan.com/places
Met him last year and he inspired me. Although he wasn't using palette knife. A lot of liquin, cheap wintons and brayers.

Yass exactly right. I sometimes over do it and don't know when to stop painting. This was an example of stopping a few layers in without refining things too much. For me the texture and movement of the strokes bring the work to life.

Yasss I did. It's www.artoframan.com. I have the print shop ready to go and an uploading originals to the "shop" for sale also. My Instagram is artoframan, where I post most recent works. Thank you :)

This has always been my favorite style of painting. I'm not sure of the exact type, but I've always thought of it as 'abstract impressionism'. Someone correct me if I'm wron g.
I'd say it definitely falls on the line of abstract impressionism. Some of my works start there but will have focal areas rendered to a realism approach to extend that range from obsecure to definition in the overall image. This one was left in the early layered stages but I think the harmony and atmosphere are present.

I'm a little disappointed but I understand. I had to write my name on there because people were sharing my work without giving me credit to get likes and followers on Instagram. This was the first time I posted the full original version of the painting so I'm very sad it had to be taken down, especially because of the momentum is was gaining. :(
Both. I teach art and sell my work full time. :)

Took me 4 months... One month alone for researching and planning , sketching etc. Yes I'm planning on having an unveiling after some traveling I must do for my upcoming exhibits. :)
Little things.... Shape of the beard.... Intensity of expression..... Age.... And roundness/structures of the faces.

WRITING.TEXT: Ahhh! That's so awesome. Thank you for sharing that. Means a lot
Hi guys, if you'd like to see the progress of this painting live, I'm always on painting day and night on my instagram live. My name is art_of_raman, come find me and chat with me

I agree completely actually. I am livestreaming this on my instagram day and night and some of the comments I'm getting are ridiculous. People are getting angry over me not having my head covered, playing music in the background, and the little things like that. I think it's a matter of education... my mother actually believes she can scream cuss yell all day long and walk into the gurdwara with her head covered to make everything alright. I feel the actual beliefs systems are being lost and in their place, are these certain actions that leave most people with a false sense of accomplishment. I have a lot more to say but uhhh i gotta get started on the next painting sessiion..... join me if you'd like.. instagram:art_of_raman

Hi-jacking top comment but I forgot to tell you guys I'm live streaming the progress of this painting every day and night until I finish so follow me and come kick it virtually in the session. instagram: art_of_raman
Sorry guys btw. Follow me on Instagram to see me live paint this piece until finish. art_of_raman

WRITING.TITLE: Hi guys, I wanted to share a painting with you that I've been working on for two months now. The Gurus of Sikhism (oil painting in progress)

WRITING.TEXT: Same thing my friend u/bontucomment said. I work in oils and layers so everything is established before adding further and further detail. If i "mess up" - I just wipe away with a paper towel and still have my underlying layers present.
:O oh man, definitely didn't think about it in that sense. But.. the finished version is going to be wayyyyyy better so it's all good:)

Hey you know. I really did want to create my own version and also have done that in the past. But every other painting out there is based on the facial structures from the reference I used. The portraits in this piece are not finished and by the end of it , I will have found a way to distinguish them in my own style with detail and lighting from Sobha Singh's work. I will admit I'm using his paintings as a reference, it's like trying to replicate multiple masterpieces and understanding exactly what steps he took to create them in terms of compositional color arrangements as well as the facial expression down to the t. Thank you for asking though

hahaha! It's the biggest one I've ever done and spent 5 weeks researching alone. So yes, I am thinking about this one a little bit differently, i would at least like to BELIEVE it will be a masterpiece.

hmm just a little bit. I think there actually quite a few pieces like this with someone holding an umbrella just as the one point perspective recedes.

hah! Everyone keeps saying that. Take it for what it is. I made it, it's yours now.
Na I didn't imagine iit to be flame but I really enjoyed the warm lights inside the stores so I may have gone overboard with the texture. Instead of keeping it transparent and in glazes I applied the oranges very impasto-like so it turned into fire. IT's all good though
